{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.00344v1", "title": "Effective Redshift", "summary": "The "higher chromatic" Quillen-Lichtenbaum conjecture, as proposed by Ausoni
and Rognes, posits that the finite localization map $K(R) \to L_{n + 1}^f K(R)$
is a $p$-local equivalence in large degrees for suitable ring spectra $R$. We
give a simple criterion in terms of syntomic cohomology for an effective
version of Quillen-Lichtenbaum, i.e. for identifying the degrees in which the
localization map is an isomorphism. Combining our result with recent
computations implies that the finite localization map is $(-1)$-truncated in
the cases $R = \mathrm{BP} \langle n \rangle$, $R = k(n)$, and $R =
\mathrm{ko}$.", "main_category": "math.AT", "categories": "math.AT,math.KT", "published": "2025-05-01T06:42:18Z"}
